definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: A banker can hardly afford a scandal, my dear.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的，銀行家也不會向不名譽的人提供信貸。

sentences.english: You are a dishonor to our regiment.
The disgrace bowed the family to the earth.
sentences.chinese: 不名譽的事使家庭羞愧得無地自容。

sentences.english: The divorce was a disgrace to the royal family.
sentences.chinese: 該離婚案封皇家是件不名譽的事。

sentences.english: Did she show that infamous letter to you?
sentences.chinese: 她給你看了那封不名譽的信了嗎？

sentences.english: Having no marks of discredit or offense.
sentences.chinese: 沒有不名譽或犯罪行爲的記錄的。

sentences.english: She refuses to see her beloved boy die in such dishonor.
sentences.chinese: 她不願看到她深愛的男友就這樣不名譽地死去。

sentences.english: A woman regarded as disreputable or shrewish.
sentences.chinese: 被認爲是不名譽的或潑辣的女人。
